src:
中美贸易谈判令投资者失望 马股起伏不定
07 Nov 2019, 05:16 by Surin Murugiah
（吉隆坡7日讯）对中美贸易谈判前景感到失望，马股走势起伏不定，跟随区域市场走势。
休市时，富时隆综指下滑0.16点，报1603.09点，盘中曾扬至1605.06点。
上升股略多，有276只、下跌股263只，510只无起落。成交量有13亿1000万股，值6亿9857万令吉。
主要下跌股包括Nestle (M) Bhd、Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd、Hong Leong Financial Group Bhd、Public Bank Bhd、AirAsia Group Bhd和Yinson Holdings Bhd。
热门股有Velesto Energy Bhd、Karambunai Corp Bhd、FoundPac Group Bhd、Sanichi Technology Bhd和Bumi Armada Bhd。
上升股则有Carlsberg Brewery Malaysia Bhd、Petronas Dagangan Bhd、Heineken Malaysia Bhd、Teck Guan Perdana Bhd、MISC Bhd、Genting Plantations Bhd、UWC Bhd和Pharmaniaga Holdings Bhd。
路透社报道，亚洲股市周四勉强守在数月高位附近，债券反弹，因有关美中将推迟签署初步贸易协议的报导令投资者感到失望。
MSCI明晟亚太地区（除日本）指数微跌0.1%，略低于本周稍早所及6个月高位。
艾芬黄氏资本研究指出，根据日线图，20天移动平均线（EMA）稳步趋向50天EMA，为正面信号，因为如果成功突破，将进一步推动综指看涨前景。
该研究机构表示：“技术压抑后反弹正在上演。”
（编译：陈慧珊）

English version：
KLCI seesaws as US-China trade talks frustrate investors

Via theedgemarkets.com
text:
Sino-US trade negotiations disappoint investors
07 Nov 2019, 05:16 by Surin Murugiah
(Kuala Lumpur, 7th) Disappointed with the prospects of Sino-US trade negotiations, the FBM KLCI is fluctuating and following the trend of the regional market.
At the close of the market, the FBM KLCI fell 0.16 points to 1603.09 points, and the intraday session rose to 1605.06 points.
The number of rising stocks was slightly higher, with 276 and 263 losing stocks, and 510 had no ups and downs. The trading volume was 1.31 billion shares, valued at RM 859.87 million.
Major downtrends include Nestle (M) Bhd, Fraser & Neave Holdings Bhd, Hong Leong Financial Group Bhd, Public Bank Bhd, AirAsia Group Bhd and Yinson Holdings Bhd.
Popular stocks include Velesto Energy Bhd, Karambunai Corp Bhd, FoundPac Group Bhd, Sanichi Technology Bhd and Bumi Armada Bhd.
The rising stocks include Carlsberg Brewery Malaysia Bhd, Petronas Dagangan Bhd, Heineken Malaysia Bhd, Teck Guan Perdana Bhd, MISC Bhd, Genting Plantations Bhd, UWC Bhd and Pharmaniaga Holdings Bhd.
Reuters reported that Asian stock markets barely stayed near the highs for several months on Thursday, and the bond rebounded, as investors were disappointed that the US-China plan to postpone the signing of the preliminary trade agreement.
MSCI's Asia Pacific (excluding Japan) index fell slightly by 0.1%, slightly lower than the earlier six-month high this week.
Affin Huang's Capital Research pointed out that according to the daily chart, the 20-day moving average (EMA) is steadily moving towards the 50-day EMA, which is a positive signal, because if it breaks, it will further push the KLCI bullish outlook.
The research institute said: "The rebound after the technical suppression is taking place."
(Compile: Chen Huishan)

English version:
KLCI seesaws as US-China trade talks frustrate investors

Via theedgemarkets.com
